p: There are limited data on the epidemiology of PD in many MENASA countries ( TableÂ 1). Many data available from door-to-door epidemiologic studies conducted in MENASA countries are from decades prior. Incidence rate data were available for only 2 countries; PD incidence per 100,000 was 4.5 in Libya in 1982-1984 [ 12], and 5.71 in Kolkata, India in 2003 to 2007 [ 13]. In the past decade, door-to-door studies on the prevalence of PD were found only for Egypt [ 14, 15]. Among South Asian countries, prevalence data for India are robust [ 16, 17], and some data were found for Pakistan [ 18] but not other countries.
